metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9526 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Libgcrypt before 1.7.7, an attacker who learns the EdDSA session key (from side-channel observation during the signing process) can easily recover the long-term secret key. 1.7.7 makes a cipher/ecc-eddsa.c change to store this session key in secure memory, to ensure that constant-time point operations are used in the MPI library.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.7.6-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> EdDSA support was added in 1.6.0

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.7.6-2').
